metadata.title: CVE-2017-7619 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.4-9, an infinite loop can occur because of afloating-point rounding error in some of the color algorithms. This affectsModulateHSL, ModulateHCL, ModulateHCLp, ModulateHSB, ModulateHSI,ModulateHSV, ModulateHWB, ModulateLCHab, and ModulateLCHuv.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.7
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.7
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.7
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.7
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.7
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.7
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.7').
